match.title: 4th ODI
match.hoursInfo: 14.20 start, First Session 14.20-17.50, Interval 17.50-18.35, Second Session 18.35-22.05

headshotImage.longCaption: Kusal Perera player page headshot cutout 2021

dismissalText.commentary: David Warner lbw b NLTC Perera 60 (73b 6x4 0x6 132m) SR: 82.19

dismissalComment.html: a huge appeal for lbw and the umpire raises the finger though I thought Warner had got a big inside edge on to his pad. Warner is dismayed as he sees the finger go up and he can't review it because Clarke had used up the only review available. And he had got a massive inside edge as he played from his crease at a good length ball that pitched around leg and middle

dismissalText.commentary: Mitchell Starc not out 52 (37b 7x4 0x6 58m) SR: 140.54

headshotImage.caption: Phillip Hughes player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Phillip Hughes player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: caught behind! Kulasekara gets the ball to swing late from a good length from leg and middle stump line, Hughes is caught on the crease and squared up as he prods in defence, the outside edge is taken by Chandimal moving to his left

Clarke's been given lbw and he's asked for a review too. Kulasekara hit the pad with a big inswinger, it moved sharply into Clarke off the seam. Clarke was pushing forward and was hit in line too. Replays indicate the ball would have clipped the top of middle. He's got to go.

headshotImage.caption: Clinton McKay player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Clinton McKay player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: bowled him! McKay came out of his crease and tried to hammer the ball down the ground. It was the slower one and McKay was beaten

headshotImage.caption: David Hussey player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: David Hussey player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Thirimanne's caught it after a juggle at first slip! Malinga bowled a beautiful outswinger, pitching around off and moving away. Hussey, having been peppered by the short stuff, stayed back and prodded away from his body, nicking it to Thirimanne's left. He caught it, lost grip but grabbed it again before falling to the ground.

Johnson isn't standing outside his crease, and he's fallen lbw, that is plumb. Malinga delivers a full ball that slants across Johnson from over the wicket before it tails late into the left-hander. Johnson is caught prodding from his crease, the ball beats the inside edge and crashes into the pad. No doubt there.

headshotImage.caption: Phillip Hughes player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Phillip Hughes player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Phillip Hughes player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Phillip Hughes player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Phillip Hughes c Chandimal b Kulasekara 1 (8b 0x4 0x6 9m) SR: 12.5

dismissalComment.html: caught behind! Kulasekara gets the ball to swing late from a good length from leg and middle stump line, Hughes is caught on the crease and squared up as he prods in defence, the outside edge is taken by Chandimal moving to his left

dismissalText.commentary: Michael Clarke lbw b Kulasekara 20 (20b 2x4 0x6 38m) SR: 100

dismissalComment.html: Clarke's been given lbw and he's asked for a review too. Kulasekara hit the pad with a big inswinger, it moved sharply into Clarke off the seam. Clarke was pushing forward and was hit in line too. Replays indicate the ball would have clipped the top of middle. He's got to go.

headshotImage.caption: David Hussey player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: David Hussey player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: David Hussey player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: David Hussey player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: David Hussey c Thirimanne b Malinga 1 (9b 0x4 0x6 11m) SR: 11.11

dismissalComment.html: Thirimanne's caught it after a juggle at first slip! Malinga bowled a beautiful outswinger, pitching around off and moving away. Hussey, having been peppered by the short stuff, stayed back and prodded away from his body, nicking it to Thirimanne's left. He caught it, lost grip but grabbed it again before falling to the ground.

dismissalText.commentary: George Bailey c NLTC Perera b Herath 22 (39b 2x4 0x6 43m) SR: 56.41

dismissalComment.html: what has Bailey done! He came down the pitch and tried to hit over the top, instead he mis-hit it straight to Thisara Perera at mid-on, he's thrown away a start, and after he battled hard early on. Bailey was beaten in the flight

dismissalText.commentary: David Warner lbw b NLTC Perera 60 (73b 6x4 0x6 132m) SR: 82.19

dismissalComment.html: a huge appeal for lbw and the umpire raises the finger though I thought Warner had got a big inside edge on to his pad. Warner is dismayed as he sees the finger go up and he can't review it because Clarke had used up the only review available. And he had got a massive inside edge as he played from his crease at a good length ball that pitched around leg and middle

headshotImage.caption: Moises Henriques player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Moises Henriques player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Moises Henriques player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Moises Henriques player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Moises Henriques lbw b Herath 3 (11b 0x4 0x6 10m) SR: 27.27

dismissalComment.html: another lbw, and the umpires have missed another inside edge! Herath bowled the one that goes on with the arm to Henriques, who prodded forward to defend. The ball went on to the pad off the inside edge, and like Warner, Henriques has to go too

dismissalText.commentary: Mitchell Johnson lbw b Malinga 10 (25b 0x4 0x6 24m) SR: 40

dismissalComment.html: Johnson isn't standing outside his crease, and he's fallen lbw, that is plumb. Malinga delivers a full ball that slants across Johnson from over the wicket before it tails late into the left-hander. Johnson is caught prodding from his crease, the ball beats the inside edge and crashes into the pad. No doubt there.

dismissalText.commentary: Matthew Wade c Kulasekara b NLTC Perera 31 (53b 1x4 0x6 85m) SR: 58.49

dismissalComment.html: caught at third man! Wade's gone. The ball was short of a length outside off, Wade got under it and cut hard off the front foot, slashing it straight to Kulasekara as he ran in from the third man boundary, Australia lose their eighth

headshotImage.caption: Clinton McKay player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Clinton McKay player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Clinton McKay player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Clinton McKay player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Clint McKay b Kulasekara 2 (11b 0x4 0x6 16m) SR: 18.18

dismissalComment.html: bowled him! McKay came out of his crease and tried to hammer the ball down the ground. It was the slower one and McKay was beaten

dismissalText.commentary: Tillakaratne Dilshan not out 9 (9b 1x4 0x6 16m) SR: 100
Mahela Jayawardene not out 4 (11b 0x4 0x6 16m) SR: 36.36

headshotImage.caption: Clinton McKay player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Clinton McKay player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: defended off the back foot on the off side
short of a length outside off stump, Mahela lets it go
short of a length outside off, Dilshan lets it go

commentPostTextItems.html: It's still drizzling at the SCG. Mahela's having a word with the umpire about it. The umpires decide to continue playing.

headshotImage.caption: Clinton McKay player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Clinton McKay player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: width outside off stump and Dilshan sends the ball racing to the cover boundary with a powerful drive off the front foot
length once again outside off, Dilshan finds the gap at cover with a front-foot drive
a length ball outside off stump, Dilshan moves forward and drives the ball through mid-off
short of a length outside off stump, Mahela stays in his crease and cuts the ball towards third man
Wade leaps like a football goalkeeper to bring the wayward ball down leg side with both hands
Mahela lets a good length ball go outside off
a huge swing from Dilshan across the line, Starc pitches on a good length and shapes the ball across the right-hander before bending it back in, that nearly shaved off stump

headshotImage.caption: Clinton McKay player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Clinton McKay player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: Dilshan tries to work the ball on the leg side but mis-times it

commentPreTextItems.html: There's a drizzle at the SCG.

commentTextItems.html: in the blockhole outside off stump, Mahela tries to drive through the off but gets an inisde edge on the leg side, Dilshan calls him through for a single
Mahela stays in his crease and defends on the leg side
full ball outside off stump, Mahela drives fluently but the shot is stopped at short cover

commentPreTextItems.html: Here's Starc, from over the wicket. Two slips in place.

commentTextItems.html: there's an inside edge on to the pad and there's no lbw appeal. Starc pitched the ball full and got it to shape into Mahela after slanting across him, Mahela tried to play on the leg side and closed the face
short of a length outside off, McKay lets it go with a grunt, Dilshan also lets it go, without grunting

headshotImage.caption: Clinton McKay player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Clinton McKay player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: Dilshan attempts a booming drive to a good length ball that holds its line and is beaten

commentPreTextItems.html: Gareth: "Expect Starc to bowl with venom. He'll be pumped after that innings!"

commentTextItems.html: Mahela moves back and across to dab a good length ball on the leg side for a single
Dilshan cuts a good length ball outside off, mis-times it behind point
the ball rises and angles into Mahela from outside off stump, Mahela gets on top of the bounce and opens the face of his bat off the back foot to steer the ball to third man

commentPreTextItems.html: 9.00 Very unexpected news from the SCG, the game has been called off. Loud boos from an enthusiastic SCG crowd as they hear the news over the PA system. There's been no rain for 45 minutes, and it didn't rain for very long and it wasn't very heavy either. So I'm quite surprised by this decision.

Michael Clarke: "As you can hear the crowd is very disappointed, it was nice of them to stick around. Having said that we wanted to play .. have a crack at winning the game ... we have to take the umpires' judgement ... it was completely up to the umpires. We thought there was going to be enough in the wicket ..."
The Sri Lankans go to the section of the SCG filled with their supporters and give them a wave.
"Due to the poor condition of the outfield the match has been abandoned," says the message on the large screen at the SCG. Why didn't they cover more of the SCG then?
Devalochana: "This is amazing... Back here in SL we have heaps of rain and still have games played since we cover the entire grounds. Shocking to see that Australian grounds are like this..!"
Rob Noah: "Dont quite remember this happening in.. well, since I've been watching cricket. I simply imagine there are massive puddles and potholes my eyes cannot detect."

Micka: "Marius Erasmus and Paul Reiffel are not popular in Australia at the moment. Not only did they give Warner and Henriques out LBW when they hit the ball, they have called off the game 45 minutes after rain stopped falling because the outfield was slightly damp. Maybe the umpires should have thought about the fans who were waiting for over 2 hours for play to resume before they decided to make another bad decision. No wonder ODIs are on the way out...."

Well that's all we have for you today. Sri Lanka lead the series 2-1 and can't lose it now as the teams head to Hobart for the final ODI. An unexpected and rather inexplicable end today, ruined what could have been an absorbing chase.
Thank you for all your emails and thank you for your patience. Do join us on January 23 for the fifth and deciding ODI. Cheers.

8.30 pm The stumps have been put back in at the SCG. However, the umpires have inspected the conditions and word is they haven't decided on a resumption time yet. They want to let the ground dry out some more.

8.10 pm Looks like the crowd is dancing to the YMCA ... and it looks like the umpires are going to inspect the edges of the square for dampness in about ten minutes. They are taking a rope across the outfield and the super sopper is at work too, to take the surface water off.
Chris: "Have the crowd done the YMCA song yet? Well done on the beer snake...and cant we just give SL the win - they were 4-0 after 2 overs and Oz were 4-1...match sorted..."
The covers are coming off too, so not too far from a re-start.
8.00 pm The rain has stopped at the SCG and the groundstaff are having a look at the damage it's caused.
"The SCG crowd has apparently broken the record for the longest beer-cup snake. It went the length of the Victor Trumper Stand," says our correspondent Dan Brettig, who is at the venue.
Gareth: "Australia's chances droop with every over that's lost. They'll need to remove the openers almost immediately."
The umpires are out there speaking to Tom Parker, the SCG curator. The square is still covered.
7.30 pm No improvement in the weather at the SCG. Still drizzling.

7.15 pm Still drizzling at the SCG. And Caron writes in with not-so-good news: "@vignesh- i live about 3km from the SCG and its pouring cats and dogs over here ... doesn't look like its gonna stop anytime soon."

6.55 pm Mahela backs away as the bowler approaches the crease. I think he's saying the drizzle is impairing his vision, I can't be sure though. And they are going off. It's got a bit heavier. The groundstaff bring on the covers.
vignesh: "It should be a passing shower. I'm staying 15kms north of the stadium and it is quite clear here. I don't think D/L would be a case today"

dismissalText.commentary: Mahela Jayawardene not out 4 (11b 0x4 0x6 16m) SR: 36.36
Tillakaratne Dilshan not out 9 (9b 1x4 0x6 16m) SR: 100

stories.title: 'Longest beer snake' spotted at SCG
stories.subTitle: Australian cricket
stories.summary: The abandonment of Sunday's ODI between Australia and Sri Lanka in Sydney left many dissatisfied but some in the crowd channelled their frustration in a productive way, creating the longest beer snake

stories.title: Warner reprimanded for showing dissent
stories.subTitle: Australia v Sri Lanka, 4th ODI, Sydney
stories.seoTitle: David Warner reprimanded for showing dissent
stories.summary: David Warner, the Australia batsman, has received an official reprimand after pleading guilty to a Level 1 breach of the ICC Code of Conduct during the Sydney ODI against Sri Lanka on Sunday.
